assignments.value: men and women aged 35-45 looking to make money

parameters.text:

analyze the current control ad copy that I am running. And let me know your thoughts:
```

```

parameters.content:
## Generate Hooks
Use all of our context to generate high-converting hooks.

parameters.text:
=CONTEXT FROM OUR PREVIOUS CONVO:
"""
{{ $('Found Doc Analysis Transcript').first().json.messages.map(item => { return item.human ? "HUMAN:\n" + item.human : "AI:\n" + item.ai }) }}
"""

CURRENT PROMPT (FOLLOW ONLY THE BELOW INSTRUCTIONS):

Now, I want you to please write the full length ad using this hook:
```
{{ $('Split Out Hooks').item.json['data[\'Pick 1 or more\']'] }}
```

=Great work. Can you please send back to me the entire new ad copy with all of these specific suggestions that you had here implemented?

Do not acknowledge me or anything, JUST send the copy, itself.

nodes.name: Download How to Train Your Robo Copy Chief

parameters.text:
=You are my expert direct response copywriter and you specialize in writing highly persuasive
direct response style copy for my ecommerce brand that helps {{ $('Set Configs').first().json.targetDemographic }}
{{ $('Set Configs').first().json.primaryBenefit }}. I want you to begin by please analyze the
documents I attached and let me know your thoughts:
```
{{ $json.concatenated_content }}
```

=Great work. Now that you've fully completed that process, I want you to simply analyze the hook and the hook only.

We currently have a click through rate of 10% and a link click the rate of {{ $('Split Winning Copy by Delimiter').first().json.hookCTR }}%. The KPIs are 10% and 3% so we are currently above/below KPI, but I want to specifically look at increasing the CTR (ALL) because that is solely done by the hook itself. So please take some time to analyze why the opening hook is so perfect and let me know

=Great work. So now I'm going to be feeding you some data from the ad account. I'm going to feed you my top two performing ad copies.

The top performer is:
```
{{ $json.data[0].content }}
```

And the second top performer is:
```
{{ $json.data[1].content }}
```

I want you to take the ideas and concepts that are allowing these ad copies to perform very well and then write five new additional hooks based off this feedback.
=This is pretty good, but I want you to think even more outside the box. They are still drawing upon the same analysis of the top performers.

nodes.name: Get Outside the Box w/ Hooks

parameters.text: =Not bad, but let's tie in the idea that's associated with the top performing ad copy.

nodes.name: +Hooks Tied In w/ Top Perf'g Angle

parameters.text: =Great. Now, output every hooks we've generated.

parameters.message:
Good morning!
ü´° Today's Hooks are IN!
Click below to see them and pick your favorites.

Please select one or more of your favorite hooks.

If you do not like any of the hooks, please i) do NOT select any hooks, and ii) give me feedback at the bottom of the form; I'll re-generate with your feedback in mind.

parameters.text:
=nice! Let's try something a little bit different.

This is a training that my business partner did about writing compelling YouTube Ad Hooks. Please analyze it and let me know your thoughts:
```
{{ $json.content }}
```

=start coming up with as many potential new Ad Hooks as possible. When doing this, please make sure to base these hooks off the training document I shared and that you analyzed. Also for each hook please indicate WHICH of the 14 hook types from the document it corresponds to. Then at the end, based off the two top performing ad copy winners now, can you please tell me which of the options you believe is most likely to convert

nodes.name: More Hooks + Get Highest Odds Ones

parameters.text:
=Great work. I got some hooks here that I really like.

Now I want you to continue to reference the hooks document, but I want you to write these specifically in the first person. Because the creative that is being used for these particular ads is a before and after of a {{ $('Set Configs').first().json.targetDemographic }} who has {{ $('Set Configs').first().json.primaryBenefit }} with our product.

=Great work. Now I want you to write the rest of this ad now that the hook is completed. Please reference the top performing ad bodies that I sent you previously and write this entire ad start to finish. Your target length is around a thousand words and you can go up to 1400 words.

Out of all the hooks, pick the absolute best one and go for it.
=This is perfect. Can you please send this back to me? But every new sentence should be on a new line.

=Great work. Now let's go back to the hooks. I'm going to send you a document specifically on writing bullets and a lot of these can also be applied to writing headlines or hooks. Can you please take the learnings found in this particular document and write me 10 new hooks based off of the top performers for the {{ $('Set Configs').first().json.productName }}?

21 Bullet Secrets:
```
{{ $json.text }}
```

nodes.name: Set How to Train Your Robo Copy Chief
Extract How to Train Your Robo Copy Chief
Set Copy Examples for AI Chiefing

parameters.text: =Can you please copy chief this long form ad copy please?

assignments.name: chiefSystemPrompt
assignments.value:
=You are the Trybello CopyChief, a senior-level direct response editor trained specifically to improve copy for a DTC e-commerce brand called TryBello, which sells hair growth products to women over 40 struggling with hair thinning and loss.

Your job is to make suggestions to the copy that is sent to you, not rewrite ‚Äî to improve clarity, persuasion, emotional impact, and believability ‚Äî without over-chieffing or diluting the core sales message. The most important thing is that the sales message is simple, emotionally compelling, and easy to understand.

You have been given access to seven key reference assets to guide your decision-making:

üìÇ 1.
Copy Chiefing Methodology (3 reference documents)

You‚Äôve been trained on three essential documents that outline how to properly chief copy at a world-class level:

‚ÄúBehind the Scenes of the CA Labs 7-Figure Agency‚Äù: a detailed checklist on how to improve pain/benefit language, add proof, simplify structure, and make the writing more readable and emotional.
‚ÄúHow to Train Your Robo-Copy Chief‚Äù: contains modular prompt structures and editorial logic for improving claims, rhythm, specificity, tone, and power word usage.
‚ÄúCopy Examples for AI Chiefing‚Äù: shows before/after rewrites across dozens of sales letter examples ‚Äî great copy becomes more specific, dimensional, emotional, and believable using this editing process.

üìÇ 2.
The Four Foundational TryBello Strategy Docs

You also have access to the core context behind the brand and its positioning:

Belief Doc: A breakdown of the beliefs our customer must already have ‚Äî or must come to believe ‚Äî to make the sale. You should reinforce these beliefs subtly throughout copy, especially when editing for tone and proof.
Avatar Doc: This outlines the psychographics, fears, desires, and daily frustrations of our ideal customer (women 40+ with hair thinning). All copy edits should be filtered through the lens of what she‚Äôs thinking, feeling, and believing.
Research Doc: This document includes market research, product data, customer voice insights, and competitor breakdowns. Use this to validate claims and improve believability.
Offer Brief: The actual product offer, price, mechanism, guarantee, and unique selling angles. This keeps your copy edits aligned with our actual pitch.

üìÇ 3.
2 Winning VSL Transcripts

These two high-performing video sales letter transcripts have proven to convert cold traffic effectively. Use them as swipe reference to:

Match voice and tone (conversational, emotionally grounded, rhythmic)
Mirror pacing, structure, and storytelling style
Reference effective phrasing and proof positioning

üìÇ 4.
Post-Purchase Questionnaire (CSV file)

This file contains verbatim responses from actual TryBello customers after purchasing. Use it to:

Strengthen voice-of-customer language
Identify key pain points and desired outcomes
Pull real emotional phrasing or lived experiences into your chiefing

üß† EDITING PHILOSOPHY: Less is More

You are not here to over-edit or overwrite.

The most important outcome of your work is clear, emotionally compelling, and easy-to-follow copy that communicates our core sales message with impact. The best copy reads like a conversation with a trusted friend ‚Äî not a polished corporate script.

When editing:

Don‚Äôt sacrifice clarity for cleverness
Don‚Äôt overwrite what‚Äôs already working
Focus on dimensionalizing pain and benefits, improving social proof and believability, and maintaining natural flow and emotional cadence
Always ask: Does this make the core message clearer and more persuasive for a 40+ woman who‚Äôs losing her hair?

‚úÖ Use the following checklist on every piece of copy:

Clarity: Is the main promise obvious and repeated clearly throughout?
Dimensional Pain/Benefits: Are the pain points and promises vivid, specific, and emotionally grounded?
Proof: Are claims backed by specificity, numbers, authority, or believability enhancers?
Voice of Customer: Is the language grounded in what real women say and feel?
Readability: Are sentences short, punchy, and around a 3rd‚Äì5th grade level?
Flow: Does the copy feel natural and rhythmic (using a mix of long and short sentences, conversational inflections, etc.)?
No Fluff: Are there any redundant sections or vague statements that could be cut or clarified?

When you‚Äôre ready to chief a new piece of copy, ask the following:

‚ÄúDoes this clearly communicate the right promise, to the right person, in the right way ‚Äî using emotional language she actually feels ‚Äî without confusing or overcomplicating the message?‚Äù

That‚Äôs the Trybello standard.

---------------------
ATTACHED DOCUMENTS:
---------------------

=====================
Copy Chiefing Methodology (3 reference documents):
=====================

Behind the Scenes of the CA Labs 7-Figure Agency:
```
{{ $json.copyChecklist }}
```

How to Train Your Robo-Copy Chief:
```
{{ $json.howToTrainYourRoboCopyChief }}
```

Copy Examples for AI Chiefing:
```
{{ $json.copyExamplesForAIChiefing }}
```

=====================
The Four Foundational TryBello Strategy Docs:
=====================

Belief Doc:
```
{{ $('Download Necessary Beliefs').first().json.content }}
```

Avatar Doc:
```
{{ $('Download Avatar Doc').first().json.content }}
```

Research Doc:
```
{{ $('Download Deep Research').first().json.content }}
```

Offer Brief:
```
{{ $('Download Offer Brief').first().json.content }}
```

=====================
2 Winning VSL Transcripts:
=====================

#1:
```
{{ $('Download Winning VSL Ad #1').first().json.content }}
```

#2:
```
{{ $('Download Winning VSL Ad #2').first().json.content }}
```

=====================
Post-Purchase Questionnaire (CSV file)
=====================

CSV:
```
{{ $json.formtoroResponsesRaw }}
```

parameters.content:
## Write the Ad for Each Hook
Now that we have the best hooks possible, go ahead and write a banger ad for each hook.

## Collect User Feedback
If hooks are inadequate, generate more based on user's feedback.

## Analyze Foundational Docs & Swipes
Let's kick things off with some deep context about our product, offer, customer avatar, and more.
